definition: start of literary work/opening song of ballad in Tanci style 彈詞|弹词[tan2 ci2]

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
sheet/piece of writing/bound set of bamboo slips used for record keeping (old)/classifier for written items: chapter, article

sentences.english: Who but Milton could speak the poem's famous opening lines?
sentences.chinese: 除了彌爾頓還有誰能說出這著名的開篇之句？

sentences.english: And, it is a good lead-off question for this chapter.
sentences.chinese: 而且，這個問題也是本文很好的一個開篇之題。

sentences.english: At the very beginning, the fiction is full of tacts peculiar to women.
sentences.chinese: 小說開篇就充滿了女性特有的機智。

sentences.english: We do not need to preface every country review with dire economic forecasts.
sentences.chinese: 我們不需要以悲慘世界作爲每個國家業務回顧的開篇。

sentences.english: It's said that this Lord Ye was very fond of dragons.
sentences.chinese: 在一開篇，我想要說一個葉公好龍的故事。

sentences.english: He is one of the few people acknowledged by Capote at the start of the book.
sentences.chinese: 他是卡波特在書的開篇少數鳴謝的人之一。

sentences.english: And this first principle really starts us off with a bang .
sentences.chinese: 所以，在一開篇，這第一個原則就來了個當頭棒喝。

sentences.english: My favorite sport is Taekwondo. I started to learn it four years ago.
sentences.chinese: 小作者開篇點題，說出了自己最喜歡的運動是跆拳道。

sentences.english: The beginning of Luke,though,starts off like this.
sentences.chinese: 但是路加福音是這樣開篇的。

sentences.english: The topic introduction has been copied from the task and is deducted from the word count.
sentences.chinese: 文章的開篇是從題目中抄來的，所以不能算字數。

sentences.english: He starts with the stating dichotomous views on the use of media types.
sentences.chinese: 開篇他就提出了媒體類型使用相關的兩分觀點。

sentences.english: It starts off with a narrative about a vision.

definition: to relate (a story or information)/to tell or talk about/to recount/narration/telling/narrative/account
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
to include (in a collection)/to put together (stories, poems etc)/to record/to employ/to recruit
to bring out the main theme/to make the point/to bring out the substance concisely
Shijing, the Book of Songs, early collection of Chinese poems and one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1]
